08/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~STRENGTH FOR THE MOMENT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"These things I have spoken to you, that in Me you might have peace.
In the world you have tribulation, but take courage, I have overcome
the world." (Jn. 16:33)

Our Lesson for Today:
Yes even a believer will have tribulations in this world. But Jesus says,
"Don't be surprised when they come, but be of good cheer, I have overcome
the world." He's saying, "There is nothing for you to fear." 

God does not give us overcoming life ~ He gives us life as we overcome.
We may not always enjoy it, but the strain of life is what builds our strength.
If there is no strain, there will be no strength...

Have you been asking God to give you life, liberty, and joy? ~ He cannot, 
unless you are willing to accept the strain. Once you have faced the strain, 
you will immediately get the strength. Yes He says: "To him who overcomes
I will give to eat from the tree of life..." ~ (Rev. 2:7)

God does not give us strength for tomorrow, or for the next hour, but only
for the strain of the moment. Yes a believer can "be of good cheer" even
when seemingly defeated by adversity, because victory is possible in Jesus.

Prayer Suggestion.
Dear Lord, give me the strength to face the strain
of life this moment, for I know that all things are
possible with You...Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

Lord, grant us the strength and courage to face the strains of life, for it is through these trials that we are made stronger. May we cling to the promise of the Tree of Life, and may our lives be a testament to Your faithfulness. Amen.

08/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE COMPELLING PURPOSE OF GOD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Gathering the twelve disciples around Him, Jesus told them, 
"As you know, we are going to Jerusalem. And when we get there all the 
predictions of the ancient prophets concerning the Son of Man will come true." 
(Lk. 18:31)

Our Lesson for Today:
Seeking to do "the will of the Father" was the dominating concern throughout our 
Lord's life. No matter what He encountered along the way, whether joy or sorrow, 
success or failure, He was never deterred from that purpose...
"He steadfastly set His face to go to Jerusalem..." (Lk. 9:51)

The greatest thing for us to remember is that we go up to Jerusalem to fulfill God's
purpose, not our own. In the natural life our ambitions are our own, but in the Christian 
life we have no goal of our own. We talk so much today about our decisions for Christ,
our determination to be Christians, and our decisions for this and that, but in the New
Testament the only aspect that is brought out is the compelling purpose of God. 
"You did not choose Me, but I chose you..." (Jn. 15:16)

The work we do is of no account when compared with the compelling purpose of God.
We have not yet understood all there is to know of the compelling purpose of God...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to be more faithful so that
I may fulfill to purpose you have in mind for me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/04/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE FRIENDSHIP OF GOD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He took the twelve aside...(Lk. 18:31)

Our Lesson for Today:
How often have we said, "Because so and so has some wonderful natural abilities
he will make a wonderful Christian." 

Remember this it is not a matter of our equipment, but is a matter of our poverty; 
not of what we bring with us, BUT of what God puts into us; not a matter of natural 
virtues, of strength of character, of knowledge, or of experience, all of that 
is of no avail in this concern.

The only thing of value is being taken into the compelling purpose of God and being
made His friends (see I Cor. 1:26-31). God's friendship is with those who know their
poverty. God cannot accomplish anything with the person who thinks that he is of use
to God...

As Christians we are not here for our own purpose ~ we are here for the purpose of God, 
and the two are not the same. The most important aspect of Christianity is not the work 
we do, but the relationship we maintain and the surrounding influence and qualities 
produced by that relationship...

Let us not forget ~ this relationship is the one thing that is continually under attack...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to maintain a close relationship with You.
Help me to fend off the attacks of Satan...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~THE BEWILDERING PURPOSE OF GOD

Our Bible Verses for Today:
" '...and all of the things that are written by the prophets concerning 
the Son of Man will be accomplished.'...But they understood none 
of those things..." (Lk. 18:31, 34) 

Our Lesson for Today:
God called Jesus Christ to what seemed absolute disaster. And Jesus 
Christ called His disciples to see Him put to death, leading every one 
of them to a place where their hearts were broken. His life was an absolute 
failure from every standpoint except God's.

But what seemed to be failure from man's standpoint was a triumph from 
God's standpoint, because God's purpose is never the same as Man's 
purpose...

If we are in fellowship and oneness with God and recognize that He is 
taking us into His purpose, then we will no longer strive to find out what 
His purposes are. As we grow in the Christian life, it becomes simpler 
to us, because we are less inclined to say, "I wonder why God allowed 
this or that?" ~ And we began to see that the compelling purpose of 
God lies behind everything in life, and that God is divinely shaping us 
into oneness with that purpose...

A Christian is someone who trusts in the knowledge and wisdom of God,
not in his own abilities. If we have a purpose of our own, it destroys the
simplicity and the calm, relaxed pace which should be characteristic of
the children of God...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to always wait patiently on
Your intended purpose...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/06/2010~~~food for thought~~~PRAYER ~ AN OPEN DOOR

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"In that day you will ask in My name." (Jn. 16:26a)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus is talking about a new relationship between the believer and God.
Previously, people had to approach God through priests. Since Jesus'
resurrection, any believer can now approach God directly...

Yes a new day has dawned and now all believers are priests, talking
with God personally and directly (see Heb.10:19-23)... 

Now we also need to remember, we do not approach God, because of 
our own merit, but because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us
acceptable to God...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank You for the open door You have made
between me and our Heavenly Father. Help me to continually
remain focused on our eternal home with You...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: Jesus is talking about a new relationship between the believer and God. Previously, people had to approach God through priests. Since Jesus' resurrection, any believer can now approach God directly. Yes a new day has dawned and now all believers are priests, talking with God personally and directly (see Hebrews 10:19-23). Now we also need to remember, we do not approach God, because of our own merit, but because Jesus, our great High Priest, has made us acceptable to God.
original_verse_text: "In that day you will ask in My name."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus, we have direct access to Your throne of grace. We no longer need to rely on priests, for our great High Priest, Jesus, has made us acceptable in Your sight. Lord, help us to approach You with confidence, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need. We thank You for this new and living way, and we praise You for the privilege of speaking with You directly. Amen.

08/07/2010~~~food for thought~~~AM I ABOUT MY FATHER'S BUSINESS?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"...They found Him in the temple...And He said to them, '...Did you
not know that I must be about My Father's business?' " (Lk. 2:46, 49)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do I look at my life as being in my Father's house? ~ Is the Son of God
living in His Father's house with in me? ~~~

The only abiding reality is God Himself, and His order comes to us moment 
by moment. ~ So the ultimate question is, am I continually in touch with the
reality of God, or do I pray only when things have gone wrong ~ when there 
is some disturbance in my life? ~~~

We need to learn to identify ourselves closely with the Lord in ways of holy 
fellowship and oneness that some of us have not yet even began to learn. ~~~

Think about your own circumstance. Are you so closely identified with the 
Lord's life that you are simply a child of God, continually talking to Him and
realizing that everything comes from His hands? ~ Is the eternal Child in you
living in His Father's house? ~ Have you allow Him to have His way with you? ~~~

Remember, the life of your Lord is to become your vital, simple life, and the
way He worked and lived among people while here on earth must be the way
He works and lives in you...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, forgive me for wanting to live my life my way.
Help me to live in accordance with Your will...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, may I look at my life as being in Your house, where the Son of God lives within me. Help me to stay in constant touch with the reality of Your presence, not just turning to You when troubles arise. Lord, may I be so closely identified with Your life that I am simply Your child, continually conversing with You and recognizing that all things come from Your hands. Let the eternal Child within me dwell in Your house, and may I allow Him to have His way in me, as Your life becomes my own. Amen.

08/08/2010~~~food for thought~~~AM I HONORING HIM IN PRAYER

Our Bible Verse for Today:
". That holy one who is to be born will be called the 
Son of God." (Lk. 1:35)

Our Lesson for Today:
If the Son of God was born into my human flesh, then am I truly allowing
His innocence, simplicity, and oneness with the Father the opportunity to
exhibit itself in me???

What was true of the virgin Mary in the history of the Son of God's birth
on earth is true of every born again believer. God's Son is born into me
through the direct act of God. ~~~

So then, I as His child must exercise the right of a child ~ the right of always 
being face to face with my Father through prayer. do I find myself continually
saying in amazement to the common sense part of my life, "Why did You want
me to turn here or to go over there? 'Did you not know that I must be about
My Fathers business?' " (Lk. 2:49)

What ever our circumstance may be, that holy, innocent, and eternal Child must
be in contact with His Father. The question that we must asked ourselves is, 
"Is the Son of God praying in me, bringing honor to the Father, or am I dictating 
my demands to Him? The more a person knows of the inner life of God's most 
mature saints, the more he sees what God's purpose really is...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill up in my flesh what is lacking in
the afflictions of Christ...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALWAYS ALLOW HIS SPIRIT TO WORK

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"My son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord, nor be
discouraged when you are rebuked by Him" (Heb. 12:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
Are you always fully prepared to allow God to grip you by His power
and allow Him to do a work in you that is truly worthy of Himself?

Sanctification is not our idea of what He wants to do in us. But He 
has to get us into the state of mind and spirit where we will allow
Him to sanctify us completely, what ever the cost. 
(see ~ I Thess. 5:23, 24)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray for a sensitivity and obedience to Your
Holy Spirit's leading and guiding...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

(see ~ I Thessalonians 5:23, 24)

May we willingly submit to Your refining process, knowing that Your plans for us are good and worthy of Yourself. Grant us the faith to endure, that we may become more like Christ. In Your name we pray, Amen.

08/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~A NEW LIFE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"You must be born again." (Jn. 3:7b)

Our Lesson for Today:
The question to Nicodemus' question, "How can a man be born when he is old?" 
is: 

Only when we are willing to die to everything in this life, including our rights, our
virtues, and our religion, and becomes willing to receive into ourselves a new life
that we have never experienced before (Jn. 3:4)...

a way that it would be a witness to those who are looking
for the 'Way'... Amen.

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you stubbornly doubted? (see Jn. 20:24-29)

Have you been doubting something about Jesus ~ maybe an experience to 
which others testify, but which you have not yet experienced? The other disciples
said to Thomas, "We have seen the Lord." (Jn 20:25) But Thomas doubted saying,
"Unless I see . I will not believe" (Jn. 20:25)

Thomas need the personal touch of Jesus. ~ When His touch will come we never 
know, but when they do come they will be indescribably precious." Thomas . said
to Him, 'My Lord and my God!' " (Jn. 20:28)

Have you selfishly denied Him? (see Jn. 21:15-17)

Peter denied Jesus Christ with oaths and curses (see Mt. 26:69-75), and yet after
His resurrection Jesus appeared to Peter alone. Jesus restored Peter in private,
and then He restored him publicly before others. And Peter said to Him, "Lord . 
You know that I love you." (Jn. 21:17) ~~~

Do you have a personal history with Jesus Christ?

The one true sign of discipleship is intimate oneness with Him ~ A knowledge of 
Jesus that nothing can shake...

so that my relationship with You will not be shaken by anything...Amen.

08/17/2010~~~food for thought~~~DISCOURAGED OR DEVOTED

Our Bible Verse for Today:
". Jesus . said to him, 'You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have . 
and come, follow Me.' But when he heard this, he became sorrowful, for
he was very rich." (Lk. 18:22-23)

Our Lesson for Today:
To much earthly wealth can give us a sense of false security. This man's wealth
made his life comfortable and it gave him power and prestige. When Jesus told
him to sell everything he owned, Jesus was touching the very basis of his security 
and identity...

The man did not understand that he would be even more secure if he followed 
Jesus than he was with all his wealth. Jesus does not ask believers to sell everything they have, although this may be His will for some...

But, He does ask us all, to get rid of everything that has become more important 
in our life than God. IF your possessions take first place in your life, it would be
better for you to get rid of them...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to always put You first in my life...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~SELF~AWARENESS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Come to me ." (Mt. 11:28a)

Our Lesson for Today:
We should never allow anything that divides or destroys the oneness of
our life with Christ to remain in our life without facing it. We need to beware
of allowing the influence of our friends or our circumstances to divide our
life...

This only serves to sap our strength and slow our spiritual growth. We need
to beware of anything that can split our oneness with God, causing us to see
ourselves as separate from Him...

Nothing is as important as staying right spiritually. ~ And the only solution is
a very simple one ~ "Come to Me."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to be aware of anything that
will split my oneness with You...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~COMPLETENESS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
". and I will give you rest" (Mt. 11:28b)

Our Lesson for Today:
Whenever anything begins to disintegrate you life with Jesus Christ,
turn to Him at once, asking Him to re-establish your rest. Never allow 
anything to remain in your life that is causing the unrest...

Think of every detail of your life that is causing disintegration as
something to fight against, not as something you should allow to
remain...

Ask the Lord to put awareness of Himself in you, and your selfawareness will disappear. Then He will be your all in all. Beware 
of allowing your self-awareness to continue, because slowly but
surely it will awaken self-pity, and self-pity is satanic...

Don't allow yourself to say, "Well, they have just misunderstood me,
and this is something for which they should be apologizing to me, 
I'm sure I must have this cleared up with them already."

Learn to leave others alone regarding this. Simply ask the Lord to 
give you Christ-awareness, and He will steady you until your
completeness in Him is absolute...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help be become more aware of the sins in my life,
give me a greater Christ-awareness... Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Blessed are the pour in spirit."  (Mt. 5:3)

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus began His sermon with words that seem to contradict each other.
But God's way of living usually contradicts the world's...

If you want to live for God, you must be ready to say and do what seems
strange to the world. ~ You must be willing to give when others take, to
love when others hate, to help when others abuse...

Being (pour in spirit) means giving up our own rights in order to serve others,
in so doing we will one day receive everything God has in store for us...

may seek to help those less fortunate...Amen.

08/22/2010~~~food for thought~~~A NEW BAPTISM

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I baptize you with water . but He . will baptize you with the
Holy Spirit and fire." (Mt. 3:11)

Our Lesson for Today:
John baptized people as a sign that they had asked God to forgive their sins
and had decided to live as He wanted them to live. Baptism was an outward 
sign of commitment.

To be effective, it had to be accompanied by an inward change of attitude
leading to a changed life ~ the work of the Holy Spirit.

John said that Jesus would baptize with the Holy Spirit and fire. This looked
ahead to Pentecost (Acts 2), when the Holy Spirit would be sent by Jesus in
the form of tongues of fire, empowering His followers to preach the Good News.

Remember, everyone will one day be baptized either now by God's Holy Spirit
or later by the fire of His Judgment.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to have a complete inward change 
of attitude. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

This looked ahead to Pentecost (Acts 2), when the Holy Spirit would be sent by Jesus in the form of tongues of fire, empowering His followers to preach the Good News. Remember, everyone will one day be baptized either now by God's Holy Spirit or later by the fire of His Judgment.

08/23/2010~~~food for thought~~~BATTLE IN "THE SECRET PLACE"

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"When you pray, go into your room and pray to your Father who is
unseen. Then You Father, who sees what is done in secret, will
reward you." (Mt. 6:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some people, especially the religious leaders wanted to be seen as "holy"
and public prayer was one way to get attention. Now Jesus saw through their
self-righteous acts and taught that the essence of prayer is not public style 
but private communication with God...

Yes there is a place for public prayer, but to pray only where others will notice 
you indicates that your real audience is not God...

When Jesus says "shut your door," He means we are to have a secret stillness
before God in which we deliberately shut the door on our emotions and focus
only on Him...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to put aside all my personal thoughts
and focus totally on You during my prayer time...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~MAKING A SPIRITUAL SEARCH

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Which of you, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
(Mt. 7:9)

Our Lesson for Today:
The illustration of prayer that Jesus uses here is one of a good child
who is asking for something good. I think we often talk about prayer
as if God hears us regardless of what our relationship is to Him.
(See Mt. 5:45)

We should never say that it is not God's will to give you what you ask. 
Don't faint and give up, but find out the reason you haven't received.
Let us increase the intensity of our search and examine the evidence.

These maybe some things you have never thought about which can cause
unanswered prayer. ~~~ Is your relationship right with your spouse, your
children, your co-workers, or fellow students?

do you have to say to the Lord that you have been irritable and cross,
but I still want spiritual blessings? Sorry you cannot receive and will
have to do without them until you have an attitude of a "good child."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to recognize any attitude that
I have to correct in order that I may have a product
prayer life...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

08/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~LASTING FRIENDSHIP

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I have called you friends." (Jn. 15:15b)

Our Lesson for Today:
We need to beware of letting our natural desires hinder our walk in love before God.
One of the cruelest ways to kill natural love is through the rejection that results from
having built that love on natural desires...

Love for God is not something sentimental or emotional ~ for a saint to love as God 
loves is the most practical thing imaginable...

"I have called you friends." Our friendship with Jesus is based on the new life He
created in us, which has no resemblance or attraction to our old life but only to the

08/26/2010~~~food for thought~~~ARE YOU TROUBLED?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you. ." (Jn. 14:27)

Our Lesson for Today:
I'm afraid that our peace often is based simply on our own ignorance.
But when we are awakened to the realities of life, true inner peace is
impossible unless it is received from Jesus...

When our Lord speaks peace, He creates peace, because the words
He speaks are always, "spirit, and they are life" (Jn. 6:63)...

Are you severely troubled right now? ~ Are you afraid and confused by
the waves and the turbulence God sovereignly allows to enter your life?
Have you left no stone of your faith unturned, yet still not found any well
of peace, joy, or comfort? ~ Does your life seem completely barren to 
you? ~

Then its time to look up and receive the quiet contentment of the Lord
Jesus. ~ Reflecting His peace is proof that you are right with God, because
you are exhibiting the freedom to turn you mind to Him.

If you are not right with God, you can never turn your mind anywhere but 
on yourself. If there is a problem pressing in on you right now, are you
"looking unto Jesus" (Heb. 12:2) and receiving peace from Him?

Lay everything out before Him, and when you are faced with difficulty,
bereavement, and sorrow, listen to Him say, "Let not your heart be troubled ."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to always look to You for my
peace of mind...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to he father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~ARE YOU LIVING IN THE LIGHT?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Walk while you have the light, before darkness over-takes you."
(Jn. 12:35b)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever had a mountain-top experience? ~~~ What was your
reaction? ~~~ If we do not react to our experiences with God, if we
do not obey the light, It Will Turn To Darkness...

The moment you forsake the matter of sanctification or neglect anything
else on which God has given you His light, your spiritual life begins to
disintegrate within you...

We need to continually need to bring the truth out into our real life, working
out into every area, or else even the light that you posses will itself prove
to be a curse...

You may know all about the doctrine of sanctification, ~ BUT ~ are you
working it out in everyday issues of your life? ~ Remember that every
detail of your life whether physical, moral, or spiritual, is to be judge and
measured by the standard of the atonement by the Cross of Christ...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Take my life and let it be consecrated Lord to Thee... Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verse for Today:
. One of His disciples said to Him, 'Lord teach us to pray.'
(Lk. 11:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
STOP RIGHT NOW ~ ~ ~ Now turn in your Bible and read vs. 2 - 4 of chapter 11.
DO IT! ! !

Now ~ ~ ~ Take notice of the order in this prayer.
First, Jesus praised God ~ ~ ~ Then, He made His request.

Praising God first ~ ~ ~ Puts us in the right frame of mind to tell Him
about our needs. 

Think about it ~ ~ ~ Aren't our prayers often more like shopping lists
than conversations with the Lord.

Prayer Suggestion: (Now let us give thanks)

Dear Lord I thank You for forgiving me of my sins, which are many ~
I Thank You for Your loving kindness of which I do not deserve ~
I thank You for Your availability always hearing my beckoned call. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

08/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~FAITH THAT BRINGS GLORY TO GOD

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus said to her, "Did I not tell you that if you believed,
you would see the glory of God?" (Jn. 11:40)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever thought of the fact that, any trial a believer faces can
ultimately bring glory to God? ~ You say how? ~ Well because God
can bring good out of any bad situation. (See Gen. 50:20; Ro. 8:28)

What usually happens when trouble comes your way? ~ ~ ~ Do you
grumble ~ complain ~ and blame God, or do you see your problems 
as opportunities to honor God...

Remember faith must be tested, because it can only become your 
intimate possession through conflict.What is challenging your faith 
right now? ? ? The test will either prove your faith right, or it will kill it.
Jesus said, "Blessed is he who is not offended because of Me." (Mt. 11:6)
The ultimate thing is confidence in Jesus.

Faith is ~ Absolute trust in God ~ A trust that could never imagine that 
He would forsake us (see Heb. 13:5-6)

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to see the good which can come from
the trials that come in this life. Help me to continue to trust
in You through them. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

08/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~TRUE RELATIONSHIP

Our Bible Verse for Today:
After the disciples return to Jesus with their good news Jesus says to them,
"Do not rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you,
but rather rejoice because your names are in heaven." (Lk. 10:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
What Jesus is saying here is "Don't rejoice in your successful service 
for Me, but rejoice because of your relationship with Me."

The trap you may fall into in Christian work is to rejoice in successful
service, that is rejoicing in the fact that God has used you. Yet you will
never be able to measure fully what God will do through you if you have
a right-standing relationship with Jesus Christ.

If you keep your relationship right with Him, then regardless of your 
circumstances or whoever you encounter each day, He will continue
to pour "rivers of living water" through you (Jn. 7:38)

Once we have the right relationship with God through salvation and 
sanctification, remember that what ever your circumstances may be
you have been placed in them by God. And God uses the reaction of 
your life to your circumstances to fulfill His purpose, as long as you 
continue to "walk in the light as He is in the light." (I Jn.1:7)

It is the work that God does through us that counts, not what we do for Him.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to be a useful vessel for You...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

08/31/2010~~~food for thought~~~"MY JOY . YOUR JOY"

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"I have told you this so that My joy may be in you and that 
your joy may be complete." (Jn. 15:10)

Our Lesson for Today:
What was the joy Jesus had? ~ ~ ~ Joy should not be confused with happiness.
In fact, it is an insult to Jesus Christ to use the word happiness in connection
with Him. The joy of Jesus was His absolute self-surrender and self-sacrifice
to His Father ~ the joy of doing that which the Father sent Him to do ~ 
".who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross."  (Heb. 12:2)

Living a full and overflowing life does not rest in bodily health, in circumstances,
nor even in seeing God's work succeed, but in the perfect understanding of God,
and in the same fellowship and oneness with Him that Jesus Himself enjoyed.

All that God has done for us is merely the threshold ~ He wants us to come to the 
place where we will be His witnesses and proclaim who Jesus is.

A person who has the right relationship with God lives a life as natural as breathing
wherever he goes...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, Help me to be a more willing witness for You.
I pray that I may have the same fellowship and oneness
with You that Jesus had.Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

09/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~DESTINED TO BE HOLY

Our Bible Verse for Today:
". it is written, 'Be holy, for I am holy'" (I Pet. 1:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Even after we commit our lives to Christ, ~ sometimes ~ we still feel a pull
back to our old ways... Peter tells us to be like our heavenly Father ~ Holy
in everything we do...

Holiness: means being totally devoted or dedicated to God ~ set aside
for His special use and set apart from sin and its influence. ~ We're to be
set apart and different, not blending in with the crowd, YET not being different
just for the sake of being different...

God's qualities in our life make us different. ~ Our focus and priorities must 
be His. ~ ALL this is in direct contrast to our old ways. There is no way we can 
become holy on our own, BUT God gives us His Holy Spirit to help us obey
and to give us power to overcome sin...

Don't use the excuse that you can't help slipping into sin.
Rely on God's power to free you from sin's grip...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I need Your Holy Spirit's power every day,
help me to be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6
